page.content: RECREATION _ THE THREE HORSE SHOES, the public house on Long Lane, is a hundred years old. The kitchen used to be a cowshed and during World War II local school children used the cellar during air-raids. Most of the customers are townspeople, mainly from Derby. Once a month during the summer people pay to come from Brailsford Stables in a horse-drawn cart. Morris Dancers perform on May Day and at other times. The pub is owned by Ind. Coope and the Licensee is Mr. David Salt. Draught Burton beer and Skol larger are very popular and sell at 79p a pint. Double Diamond is 77p a pint. They also sell Kit-Kat, Mars, crisps, nuts and sandwiches. 96 gleaming horse brasses and 3 miner's lamps make it look welcoming. The dog, Shandy, who is 18 years old, is a firm favourite.
